ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Close reading and theoretical thinking. Having a highly theoretical conversation.

Aesthetics, how aesthetics connects to gender and race, the role of material objects in our life, the spectrum from consumption to production  just a more holistic way of evaluating our world, our experiences, and our objects
I gained a new, foundational understanding of images & icons in a way that has vastly expanded my perspective & interest in my major of study.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Really interesting topics and readings, but the reading load was just impossible  would have been helpful to know which key chapters to focus on
Great class. However 2 hours is a lot for class time. Could split it up or add section.
Too many of the readings are by white men

Strength: Amazing insights from Prof. Alexander, who tried his best to be engaging in seminar while also respecting students' needs. 

Weakness: Heavy (but extremely interesting) reading loads, which can severely hamper class discussion if not a lot of students are able to get familiar with the text before class - the seminar format is always a bit more difficult to engage, especially during covid.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Prof A is a giant in his field, absolutely
Absolutely, a great course with a great Professor. As a STEM student I learned so much.
Yes. Great class. Thought provoking. I liked discussions

I would recommend to students who are interested in images (art/fashion/ads), socio-economic structures, &/or gaining a new perspective on everyday life. Would highly recommend doing your best to cover all of the readings, because they really are that interesting, aside from being helpful in class (& assigned, I guess). The three essays are via prompt which helps direct your thinking on the subjects, but fear not because the final paper allows you to go in a direction of your choosing.
